programme.title: Meet The Orangutans
programme.desc: Its feeding time for the residents of Sepilok, and the orangutans are well cared for. However, they need to learn to find food themselves, and this can be tricky.

programme.title: Dodo Heroes
programme.desc: Katherine Connor and her family run an elephant sanctuary in Thailand. She wants to rescue an older elephant, Pang Fai, to release her from chains forever.

programme.title: Dogs: The Untold Story
programme.desc: Journey around the world and discover how dogs became one of the most valued animals on the planet. From wild predators to friendly pets- this is the story of mans best friend.

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People
programme.desc: The displaced Browns struggle through a devastating transition as Ami undergoes tests after health concerns. And Noah braves the wilderness to defend the homestead.

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People
programme.desc: A major diagnosis shakes the Browns, forcing them to a decision that could change their lifelong journey. And oldest son Matt tries to adjust as he reunites with Noah.

programme.title: How Do Animals Do That?
programme.desc: New science and demonstrations reveal how cats can detect an earthquake seconds before it happens. And, how do sea otters keep warm in icy waters?

programme.title: How Do Animals Do That?
programme.desc: New science and amazing demonstrations reveal why elephants have trunks. Plus, why do some animals live so long, and why do cats purr?

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Investigators respond to a report of an injured dog. Events take a dramatic turn when they arrive to discover the dogs paw has been almost completely severed.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Investigator Liz Pavlicek visits a house where more than 30 spaniels have suffered neglect. The team works to rescue the animals but are shocked by their condition.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: When a dog is found hanging by her neck in a yard the SPCA tries to save her. And investigators rush to reunite some pups with their mother before its too late.

programme.title: Life at Vet University
programme.desc: The students are halfway through their spring semester rotations. Lindsay has a hectic week treating a mare and foal for pneumonia.

programme.title: Little Giants
programme.desc: In the arid scrubland of Tinaja, New Mexico, Bradley and Billy track down the giant scolopendra centipede. Armed with venomous claws, its a relentless killer.

programme.title: Little Giants
programme.desc: Bradley and Billy are in Great Karoo, South Africa, searching for a majestic micro-dragon - the armadillo girdled lizard. It has a formidable defence mechanism.

programme.title: Dr. Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: Dr. Jeff and the team head to a remote town offering low-cost care to pets. Plus, Dr. Petra performs life-saving surgery on a Basset Hound that was hit by a car.

programme.title: Dr. Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: Shelter volunteers drive from Kansas hoping the team can save a tiny rescue dog. Dr Jeffs cousin asks for the vets to visit Tennessee to provide free care.

programme.title: Crikey! Its the Irwins
programme.desc: Robert takes part in a research experiment involving a Komodo dragon, while Terri does her best to save a koala that has been given little prospect of survival.

programme.title: Crikey! Its the Irwins
programme.desc: As Bindi celebrates her 21st birthday, she gets a surprise proposal from her boyfriend. Meanwhile, things get dangerous as Robert wrangles gators in thick mud.

programme.title: The Aquarium
programme.desc: Trainers get two rescued sea lions ready for eye surgery. Meanwhile, intelligent giant octopus, Ophelia, needs attention and the team head to the Bahamas.

programme.title: Pit Bulls And Parolees
programme.desc: A VRC senior dog finally gets the chance to have a forever home when a couple from Idaho come to New Orleans to find a new family member.

programme.title: My Cat From Hell
programme.desc: Behaviourist Jackson Galaxy offers his guidance on a cat struggling to control its bladder in a multimillion-dollar dream home. Plus, one aggressive feline bullies another.

programme.title: Animal Cribs
programme.desc: Antonio transforms a cramped condo for two cats and a rescue dog. His team builds personalised spaces into the furniture, and install a 20 ft climbing wall.

programme.title: Animal Cribs
programme.desc: Antonio and team transform a health-hazard yard into a dog-friendly escape, complete with paw-operat

programme.title: Extinct Or Alive
programme.desc: Forrest combs the Florida Everglades for the black panther, which has never been seen in the US. Discoveries in the area suggest it may be more than a rumour.

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: Wayde and Brett are asked to create two tanks for hip-hop megastar Akons dream house - but their own dreams of musical stardom look set to derail the build.

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: The San Francisco Giants want to bring McCovey Cove inside the ballpark! Can the guys build a tank big enough to impress their loyal fans?

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: Basketball legend, Dwight Howard, needs the guys at ATM to design and build a habitat for all 14 of his snakes. And he wants a reptile mansion!

programme.title: Alaska: Surviving the Last Frontier
programme.desc: Four groups of ordinary people are attempting to survive in the Alaskan wilderness. Carolyn Wise heads out on a moose hunt and the Flower Lake group stalks squirrels. The other groups are forced to take desperate measures to find food.

programme.title: Animal ER
programme.desc: When equine vet David Sutton helps Tilly, a ten year old mare, who has grass sickness and hasnt eaten for a fortnight, her owners are faced with a heart breaking decision.

programme.title: Saved By The Barn
programme.desc: The barn joins forces with a charity to find homes for four neglected calves. Meanwhile, a litter of piglets are born and Chris builds a playground for the goats.

programme.title: The Last Alaskans
programme.desc: As winter approaches Heimo and his daughter Krinn hunt for caribou. Ashley and Tyler reunite and continue building the new cabin before the cold weather sets in.

programme.title: Dodo Heroes
programme.desc: Chimpanzee expert Estelle Raballand is determined to find Ponso, the loneliest chimp in the world, a companion. Has she finally found the perfect match?

programme.title: Bad Dog
programme.desc: A dog loves all things ice cream and another dog keeps getting his head stuck in things. Plus, a parrot has a habit of rapping and swearing.

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People
programme.desc: The family prepares to close down Browntown following Amis diagnosis. Meanwhile, Bear, Bird and Rain leave the California heat to return to Alaska.

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People
programme.desc: As Ami awaits treatment options, the kids set to join Matt in Alaska packing up Browntown. But an accidental explosion leaving Matt injured causes a setback.

programme.title: Fish Or Die
programme.desc: The crew heads to Mongolia in search of taimen: the largest, most ferocious member of the salmon family. Reaching their target will involve a punishing combination of back-breaking mountain trails, treacherous rivers and uncooperative Mongolian horses.

programme.title: Crikey! Its the Irwins
programme.desc: After historical wildfires strike Australia, the Irwins race to rescue as many animals as possible. Robert and Terri help the severely injured koala population.

programme.title: The Bronx Zoo
programme.desc: A female slow loris has weight problems that stop her from becoming pregnant. Keepers take the penguin colony for a CT scan and an ocopy has pain in his hooves.

programme.title: Dr. Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: NBA superstar Anthony Davis brings Wayde and Brett on board to transform an entire room into an aquarium! Will they be able to deliver a winning tank?

programme.desc: The Raneys attempt to save a single mother and her daughter from a rampant moose, Marty builds a bridge across a creek and Matt teaches predator deterrent techniques.

programme.desc: Tia is faced with her biggest rescue with a call about abandoned dogs. When Tia, M2, Kanani, and Earl arrive, its one of the worst cases of neglect shes ever seen.

programme.title: My Cat From Hell
programme.desc: Jay has one lady in his life and thats his ferocious attack cat, Marley. Marley will tear apart anyone who crosses her path - including Jay.

programme.desc: Antonio and the team make a mountain cabin safer for Chickie, a blind senior dog. Plus, they build a Japanese-inspired indoor dog lounge.

programme.desc: Russell finds a structure he believes is a Bigfoot nest. Meanwhile, new team member Ronny joins Mireya in a race to the nest to collect DNA samples.

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People
programme.desc: The Browns try to adapt after closing their dream homestead. They face a new start with the skills and knowledge from over 35 years in the Alaskan wilderness.

programme.desc: The Raneys attempt to save a single mother and her daughter from a rampant moose, Marty builds a bridge across a creek and Matt teaches predator deterrent techniques.

programme.title: I Was Prey
programme.desc: Jordan Carbery investigates a noise outside his cabin and encounters a massive grizzly bear. And, Zanele Fox is thrown from a raft and ravaged by a crocodile.

programme.title: Les tremblements
programme.desc: Trois frères se rendent au chevet de leur mère gravement malade. Une meditation sur la mort precise et silencieuse, nimbee d’une belle photographie hivernale.

programme.title: 42 - La reponse à presque tout
programme.desc: Les revers et autres fiascos laissent souvent un goût amer, et pourtant, ils peuvent aider à mieux rebondir. Les chercheurs savent aujourd’hui que les avancees scientifiques et techniques sont le fruit de tâtonnements. En psychologie, il est admis que l’echec rend plus resilient. Alors, faut-il echouer plus souvent pour reussir sur le long terme ?

programme.title: Maux d’artistes
programme.desc: S’il est un thème qui traverse depuis ses debuts l’histoire de l’art, c’est celui de la souffrance humaine, qui entre en resonance avec nos questions existentielles face à la mort. Depuis l’avènement de l’art moderne, d’innombrables artistes aux prises avec des maux physiques ou psychiques ont su en faire un moteur puissant de creation, voire le sujet meme de leurs œuvres, à l’image des autoportraits de Vincent Van Gogh ou de Frida Kahlo.

programme.title: Les derniers paradis sauvages
programme.desc: À la decouverte de sanctuaires naturels où prospère une incroyable biodiversite. Lîle de Borneo et sa foret tropicale abritent quelque 60 000 espèces de plantes et danimaux, malgre un sol pauvre en nutriments car lessive par des pluies incessantes.

programme.title: 42 - La reponse à presque tout
programme.desc: Les cryptomonnaies divisent les esprits : si les economistes mettent en garde contre les risques d’une bulle, les adeptes du bitcoin voient là une revolution. Alors que les cryptomonnaies pourraient etre un moyen pour les Russes de contourner les sanctions occidentales mises en place suite à linvasion de lUkraine, gros plan sur ce système monetaire alternatif.

programme.title: Cellules souches : le business de lespoir
programme.desc: Les cellules souches (dites cellules mères) qui peuvent etre prelevees à la naissance d’un enfant recèlent un potentiel therapeutique dont, dans certains pays, des societes privees ont fait un marche. Enquete sur CryoSave, une biobanque dont la faillite a revele les nombreux manquements.

programme.title: Mère sous contrat
programme.desc: Pour assurer un avenir à sa fille, Zhana, jeune mère celibataire de Georgie, enchaîne les grossesses pour une agence de GPA – une pratique legale mais mal encadree. Le portrait dechirant d’une mère courage.

programme.title: ARTE Junior, le mag
programme.desc: David Le Gendre est sourd de naissance. Pourtant, il dirige un orchestre amateur à Poitiers. Il nentend pas la musique mais ressent les vibrations des instruments. Et ça fonctionne !

programme.title: 42 - La reponse à presque tout
programme.desc: On a longtemps fait des humains prehistoriques des etres rustres et primitifs. Pour autant, etaient-ils vraiment plus betes que nous ? Si lun dentre eux voyageait dans le temps jusqu’à notre epoque, pourrait-il acquerir toutes les aptitudes des humains d’aujourd’hui ?

programme.title: Les bars les plus design dans le monde
programme.desc: Des bars et restaurants repensent la convivialite, entre design atypique et atmosphère soignee. Dans cet episode : un bar de Nairobi celèbre pour ses graffitis, un restaurant dans une ancienne banque à Nuremberg et un hôtel à lesthetique "japonisante", à Munich.

programme.title: Twist
programme.desc: Prendre des risques, affronter le danger, creer quoi qu’il en coûte. Certains artistes se mettent deliberement dans des situations extremes : en territoire hostile, au cœur des conflits, meme leur propre corps devient sujet dexperimentation. "Twist" part à la rencontre de ces createurs qui, chacun à leur manière, repoussent les limites du possible.

programme.title: Chemins decole, chemins de tous les dangers
programme.desc: Dans la foret amazonienne, certains enfants doivent pagayer pendant plusieurs heures pour se rendre à l’ecole. Des traversees aussi ereintantes que perilleuses.

programme.title: Cuisines des terroirs
programme.desc: Jurgen et sa compagne Dagmar Graser sont vegetariens et utilisent lepeautre vert dans de nombreux plats : salade, risotto, rouleaux de printemps ou encore falafels. Avec ses arômes de noix, cette cereale sert aussi de base pour de delicieux gâteaux !

programme.title: Merveilleuse planète
programme.desc: Paysage côtier unique et dechiquete, la Causeway Coast, en Irlande du Nord, mele falaises abruptes et vallees verdoyantes. Sauvage et romantique, elle est celèbre pour sa chaussee des Geants, une impressionnante formation volcanique composee de 40.000 colonnes de basalte.

programme.title: Secrets sauvages du patrimoine
programme.desc: Au cœur des Carpates roumaines, en Transylvanie, se dresse le château de Bran. Cette forteresse austère est la porte dentree vers un monde de legendes. Le mythe de Dracula, le plus celèbre des vampires, trouve en effet son origine entre ces murs – et il attire aujourdhui des milliers de touristes, venus du monde entier pour toucher du doigt le mythe cree par le romancier Bram Stocker.

programme.title: Secrets sauvages du patrimoine
programme.desc: Sur lîle de Mull, entre lochs sombres et sommets noyes de brume, le château ecossais de Duart trône depuis des siècles. Cette forteresse emblematique des Highlands a longtemps incarne la grandeur de la region. Mais aujourdhui, lhistoire de ce monument semble seffacer peu à peu, eclipsee par le prestige grandissant des autres habitants de lîle : ses animaux.

programme.title: Quand lhistoire fait dates
programme.desc: Le 13 août 1521, à lissue dun long siège, Tenochtitlán-Mexico, la capitale de lEmpire aztèque, tombe entre les mains dHernán Cortes. Le conquistador sempare dune des plus grandes villes du monde, pivot de la cosmogonie aztèque. Cette histoire nest pas seulement une histoire du Mexique, cest aussi celle de la mauvaise conscience europeenne. Avec lhistorien Romain Bertrand.

programme.title: Et au milieu coule une rivière
programme.desc: Ladolescence de deux frères au debut du XXe siècle, dans la petite ville de Missoula, dans le Montana. Une epoque qui marquera un tournant dans leur vie.

programme.title: Les promesses de la terre
programme.desc: Soumises aux vents, aux embruns sales et aux tempetes, les dunes se deplacent sans cesse, menaçant parfois densevelir routes et villes. Si nous les avons depuis longtemps fixees en plantant arbres et vegetaux, les vagues de chaleur, lurbanisation et les plantes invasives mettent aujourd’hui en peril ces paysages.

programme.title: Merveilles de la nature
programme.desc: Labyrinthe de rivières et de marecages, le Pantanal est la plus grande zone humide au monde, offrant un eden à la faune sauvage. Jaguars, tapirs, caïmans, loutres geantes, aras hyacinthes... : chaque espèce remplit une fonction de regulation ou de regeneration du biotope. Que lune delles vienne à disparaître, et cest tout un pan de lecosystème qui risque de seffondrer.

programme.title: Lîle aux musees de Berlin, histoire dune nation
programme.desc: Au cœur de Berlin, cinq prestigieux musees se côtoient, reflet de la construction de la nation allemande. Autour de ce complexe qui fete cette annee son bicentenaire, un voyage artistique, museographique et historique passionnant.

programme.title: Lîle aux musees de Berlin, histoire dune nation
programme.desc: À loccasion de son bicentenaire, gros plan sur lîle aux musees de Berlin, un complexe museal unique au monde, qui expose aussi bien le buste de Nefertiti et lautel de Pergame que la porte dIshtar et des chefs-doeuvre de lImpressionnisme.

programme.title: Concerto per Milano 2025 - Riccardo Chailly, Emmanuel Tjeknavorian, Orchestra Filarmonica della Scala
programme.desc: À Milan, le traditionnel concert en plein air de lOrchestre de la Scala, dedie cette annee à la musique de film. Au programme : des thèmes composes par John Williams pour "La liste de Schindler", "E.T." et "Indiana Jones et la dernière croisade" de Steven Spielberg, mais aussi "Lollapalooza" de John Adams et "Le bœuf sur le toit" de Darius Milhaud, pièce qui devait à lorigine accompagner un film muet de Charlie Chaplin.

programme.title: Karambolage
programme.desc: Pour preparer un gâteau au chocolat en Allemagne, il convient dutiliser un "Blockschokolade" - Quel bruit fait une locomotive, en France et en Allemagne ? - Les Français adorent les comedies sur la Seconde Guerre mondiale, particulièrement "La grande vadrouille". Ce qui a le don d’embarrasser Nikola Obermann.

programme.title: ARTE Journal
programme.desc: Chaque jour à 19h45, la redaction franco-allemande dARTE Journal propose une approche europeenne et culturelle de lactualite. Un regard original sur le monde.

programme.title: Robert Redford, lange blond
programme.desc: Acteur, realisateur et producteur, l’irresistible Robert Redford s’est fait le heraut d’une Amerique ideale, à l’ecran comme dans ses engagements. Portrait d’un homme en perpetuelle quete de liberte, disparu le 16 septembre 2025.

programme.title: Le prestige
programme.desc: Londres en 1878. Rupert Angier et Alfred Borden sont deux magiciens surdoues, promis dès leur plus jeune âge à un glorieux avenir. Une competition amicale les oppose dabord lun à lautre, mais lemulation tourne vite à la jalousie, puis à la haine. Devenus de farouches ennemis, les deux rivaux vont sefforcer de se detruire lun lautre en usant des plus noirs secrets de leur art. Cette obsession aura pour leur entourage des consequences dramatiques.

programme.title: Richard Strauss : Le chevalier à la rose - Opera de Zurich
programme.desc: Une femme mariee dâge mûr perd son jeune amant, tombe amoureux de la fiancee de son cousin… Dirigee par Joana Mallwitz et mise en scène par Lydia Steier, une relecture actuelle et critique de l’opera le plus celèbre de Richard Strauss.

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In...
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade takes another 48 hour break, this time to a rather chilly Moscow with comedian Greg Davis.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: Turns out constant, relentless failure can put a strain on a relationship. Specs and Skinny are no exception, and when yet another chase ends in embarrassment, misfortune, and physical injury, the Docs finally fall prey to “irreconcilable differences”. For a shapechanger, Lamput sure doesn’t like change; it’s like mum and dad are fighting. Lamput sets about trying to help the Docs patch things up. When conventional methods fail, our orange buddy is forced to subvert the very fundamentals of animated storytelling. Lamput’s perseverance finally pays off. The Docs have an epiphany: this blob trying to fix our friendship? Obviously that’s the real enemy.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: Lamput and Specs find themselves on an island. Spec learns a harsh lesson on listening.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: Lamput’s been caught! The Docs don’t have much to do now but to give tours to visiting students. Until one of these students, Tuzki specifically, gets lost. Will Tuzki find his way back to class? Not unless Lamput has something to do with it.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy builds a look-alike robot to keep the Lemmings away while he prepares a party for his beloved she-bear. But his doubles artificial intelligence leaves a lot to be desired.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: When she is accidentally hit over the head, the she-bear Grizzy¿s in love thinks she¿s a Lemming. The only problem is that the Lemmings, who are delighted to have a new playmate, have no intention of letting him proceed with his plan.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: When a meteorite falls not far from the log cabin, strange berries start to grow. One of their properties is that they make anyone who eats them grow to disproportionate sizes.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Under the wood floor of the log cabin, Grizzy and the Lemmings discover the entrance to an underground gallery with an old treasure card that indicates the location of a treasure. Upon closer look, the representation of this treasure greatly resembles a giant jar of chocolate spread.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: When he brandishes a native american scepter that the Lemmings brought home with other antique objects, Grizzy sees the Lemmings bow low before him and behave like servants. One of them has escaped the spell, but he will have to confront both Grizzy and his fellow creatures in order to recover the scepter and reverse the spell.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy tries to impress the she-bear that hes in love with by making a sculpture of her from a piece of wood. But as soon as the artists back is turned, the Lemmings gnaw at the work of art in order to transform it into a toboggan slide. Grizzy must succeed in getting rid of the Lemmings without his model realizing whats going on. An Art in itself!

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Jerrys Uncle Harry is coming for a visit. Tuffys excited to meet the Great Uncle he has heard so much about. Harry craves a respite from his life as a nomad on the party cruise ship circuit, but it doesnt take him long to realize that life on the high seas has its advantages -- specifically, not being holed up with Tom!

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Toodles folks are coming for a visit. Problem is they think shes married with kittens. Tom plays the role of husband and volunteers Jerry and Tuffy to play their kittens.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Spike recruits Tom and Jerry to help him remove a bad tooth so he can avoid the vet.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: After believing that Jerry has been eaten by a hungry bear cub, Tom must avoid the mama bears wrath as he tries to retrieve his pal. Meanwhile, oblivious to Toms plight, Jerrys enjoying the perks of circus life.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: After Jerry mocks up a "Reward If Found" poster for Tom with the address of a neighbor with a ferocious dog, some good Samaritans bring Tom "home." Now, Tom has to escape from the house with his nine lives intact before hes brought back again and again.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: When Hildie and Beatie believe theyve had a few of their things stolen, they employ a little magic to create Bog, the Cottage Beast. In order to prove that Bog is overkill, however, Tom and Jerry must confess to borrowing the "stolen" goods to beat up on each other.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean discovers being in hospital isnt always a bed of roses.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean has to replace his landlady’s cat after an unfortunate ‘accident’.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mrs. Wickets Nephew is staying with her when he wins two tickets to an Outward Boundcourse. She refuses to go, but then ropes in Bean to look after the child. programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series

Meanwhile Mrs Wicket is on the warpath when she finds things missing from her house.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean is at a farmers’ market with Irma at her knitwear stall – right next to a man selling novelty teapots. Bean is instantly smitten with a green car-shaped one but can’t afford it. When he visits a food truck that’s laid out free samples, he hatches a plan to swipe them and sell them on his own stall so he can raise the cash for the teapot of his dreams!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Animated antics. Mrs. Wicket thwarts Mr. Beans plans to watch his favourite TV show.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean peers through the window of the opening party of an art exhibition and sees free snacks being handed around – yum! But he’s told by the bouncer that he needs to be smartly dressed. So he sneaks into the artist’s studio and paints a tuxedo onto himself. This time he’s let in, but will Bean’s fake painted suit last long enough for him to get his free food?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean is trying to watch the motor racing on TV, when Mrs Wicket interrupts him to offer a deal – revamp her garden with new paving and ornaments, and he’ll get a month’s rent for free. Bean reluctantly agrees, but when he sees Mr Paliwal finish a personal training session and keen for more, he offers him a new workout… doing all Mr Bean’s work for him while he watches the racing! Win, win!

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: While trying to escape from the Docs at a small sea side town, Lamput meets a lonely sea monster. Lamput attempts to help the sea monster makes friends but all his plans backfires. Now the locals are enraged, and the docs take the opportunity to stir up an angry mob to take down the creature and catch Lamput in the process! Not unless Lamput’s new friend has anything to say about it.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: The Docs’ latest invention generates identical versions of themselves and create a whole mob of ‘Duplicate’ Specs and Skinnies to catch Lamput! However, the device becomes faulty, and the Duplicates can’t be turned off. Now the Docs are stuck with annoying copies of themselves who are turning their lives upside down!

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: Lamput likes nothing more than a pleasant evening watching the night sky for UFOs. The peaceful night is ruined, of course, by those pesky Docs. Which is a shame, because its the one night where a UFO actually appears. Of the aliens who emerge from the strange craft, one bears a striking resemblance to Skinny - and naturally theres a bit of a mixup. The alien gets to live life as a Doc at the Lab. Hes pretty good at it, too. Skinny has to make his way as the pilot of a spaceship. Hes pretty bad at it too. In the end, the foreign food is the last straw, and both parties agree to resume their old lives. Lamput goes back to watching the skies.

So instead, Mr Bean decides to go to bed and set an alarm – yet he over-winds the clock and it breaks! With all the shops closed, his only option is to build his own complicated version to make sure he doesn’t miss the comet…

programme.desc: Mrs Wicket makes Mr Bean drive her to the hospital to get her ingrown toenail seen to and asks him to wait. But a nurse spots him, and thinking he’s a new doctor Mr Bean is asked to visit patients. How long can he keep it up before he’s found out?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Inspired by a wildlife documentary on TV, Mr. Bean dusts off his camera and treks deep into the countryside in search of the perfect wildlife photograph. After two fruitless days of being the hunter, he is somewhat miffed to find himself the hunted.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Bean discovers that, in the world of organised crime, a teddy isn’t always a teddy. Sometimes it’s a rabbit.

programme.desc: Mr Bean makes his own horror movie and ropes in Mrs Wicket as the star!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean has to look after Mrs Wicket’s goldfish but Scrapper the cat is keen to ‘help’.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean wins two tickets for an exotic cruise and naturally he takes Teddy along for the trip of a lifetime. The hungrier he gets the wilder he becomes and desperate to find a way off the island.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Beans newspaper keeps getting stolen. Who is the cunning culprit?

programme.desc: The Kazoom Kids must awaken the SuperThings from a thousand-year sleep induced by Zzleeper.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy gleefully discovers that he can print images taken with the rangers camera which is connected to a state-of-the-art printer. He decides to immortalize and frame himself…

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: A van pulls up to the rangers cabin to deliver a crate of jars of chocolate spread. While Grizzy and the Lemmings fight over a wrecking bar to open it, someone steals the crate.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: As usual, Grizzy picks the door of the Rangers log cabin to come in and make himself comfortable, but this time its impossible to enter!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings have got their hands on a pack of white beans which have very strange properties: when mixed with soda, anyone who eats them turns into a bouncing ball.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings are having a blast with a bowling game they found in the Rangers storeroom. Grizzy hastens to destroy the pins to ensure his peace and quiet. But the Lemmings discover a remote-control device that can modify the balls weight. By setting it on maximum, the ball could knock over much more than pins: furniture, a bear and even a log cabin!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings inherit a crate that fell off a Canadian army convoy. Inside, a case emits a sort of laser beam that divides objects into multiple miniaturized versions of themselves.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: Skinny might be a man of science, but he’s more than happy to get his fortune told for a laugh. The palm-reader sees alarming visions of Skinny’s near future; mostly visions that relate to Skinny being squashed, smooshed or otherwise smeared. It’s kind of Skinny’s own fault; maybe if he paid a bit less attention to chasing Lamput and a bit more attention to not getting squashed, smooshed or smeared, he wouldn’t need constant rescuing by a frazzled mystic.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Bam must lead a new super vehicle team consisting of Nightbike, Goldie, Grundy, and Kitty after the Legion of Zoom traps the rest of the Batwheels in the Batcave.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Redbird is convinced that nobody likes his eccentric dance moves, but its up to the rambunctious rally car to dance his way to victory.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: After Nightbike reveals that hes afraid of loud noises, the Batwheels help him overcome his fear so he can stop The Penguin from stealing some valuable cargo.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Feeling insecure about his size after a game of Hide-And-Seek, Buff uses the shrink belt belonging to The Atom and accidentally shrinks himself down to the size of a mouse!

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: It’s Taz’s birthday, so The Looney Builders build him a huge ice cream sundae.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: The Looney Builders race against the clock to build Cecil Turtle a new racetrack.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: George P. Mandrake hires The Looney Builders to build a T. Rex fossil.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: Pauleen Penguin hires The Looney Builders to build her a home in Looneyburg. Lola soon discovers they got the design wrong and the crew has to make adjustments.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: To Tom and Jerrys delight Gingers new no junk food in the house diet causes Rick to sleep walk every night to the local fast food joint.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Tom and Jerry take the scouts on a camping trip to canyon country and get more than they bargained for when a coyote pup shows up.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: The gang get more than they bargained for when they try to shoo away a seemingly docile spider.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: A Tom and Jerry chase through Postlewaite Manor results in major injuries to Cates which places his defense of the Butlers Linen Gloves Boxing Title in jeopardy.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Jerry pretends to be a ghost to terrorize Tom -- until he gets a fright of his own.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: When Rick and Ginger forget Toms birthday the tomcat moves in with the one person who appreciates him the local Zoos gorilla Cuddles.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Ella, Tilly, Slippy and Madhu are playing a game on the moon when it starts to rumble. The ground cracks open, and they fall into what they discover is a large network of tunnels underground.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: When Angelie breaks Slippys Jupiter gliding record, hes equally upset and fascinated by her surfboard. The two agree on a rematch and set out to work on their vehicles. They both ask Ella for help.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Ella finds her Nannys old Hide and Peek device and hopes to beat Slippys record for Hide and Seek! Gem and I.Lo are playing too. Slippy decides to make things more interesting by siphoning fuel from the Hide and Peek.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: When Glitch’s compartment empties out and a huge amount of junk floats out, Ella suggests that Slippy get rid of it. They all head to Vesta. Slippy is enchanted by the amount of stuff on the planetoid. Madhu finds something that looks like a robot so the gang sets out to find the other pieces. They quickly put together an impressive robot they call Victor. Victor is designed to recycle and he happily does just that. But when Slippy brings him back to the Clubhouse, they soon realise Victor needs to be in his home.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Its Priyas birthday, so the gang is looking for something special as a gift for her. Ella suggests a birthday star, which is a star that is the same light years away as your age.

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Its time for Adder to shed her itchy skin, but the other Riverbankers fail to understand why she is so grumpy and continually interrupt her peace and quiet.

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: When Ratty and his brother, Reggie, take Toads caravan on a trip through the countryside, sibling jealousies rise to the surface.

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: When Toad finds hes related to royalty, his airs and graces offend his friends.

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: When a duckling imprints on Toad, he finds himself with an adoring fan. In trying to rehome the duckling on the river, Toad puts it in grave danger.

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Hedge finds herself torn in several directions as she tries to help out too many of her friends.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean and Teddy are looking forward to seeing a once-in-a-lifetime comet – but it won’t appear until 4am! He tries to stay up, but it’s useless – he keeps dropping off. So instead, Mr Bean decides to go to bed and set an alarm – yet he over-winds the clock and it breaks! With all the shops closed, his only option is to build his own complicated version to make sure he doesn’t miss the comet…

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mrs Wicket makes Mr Bean drive her to the hospital to get her ingrown toenail seen to and asks him to wait. Mr Bean gets bored, and on a wander around the hospital he finds a spare doctor’s outfit with stethoscope – great Teddy - I’ll give you a check-up! But a nurse spots him, and thinking he’s a new doctor Mr Bean is asked to visit patients. How long can he keep it up before he’s found out?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Inspired by a wildlife documentary on TV, Mr. Bean dusts off his camera and treks deep into the countryside in search of the perfect wildlife photograph. After two fruitless days of being the hunter, he is somewhat miffed to find himself the hunted.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Bean discovers that, in the world of organised crime, a teddy isn’t always a teddy. Sometimes it’s a rabbit.

programme.desc: The World Today is the core rolling service of CGTN. keep viewers up-to-date with all the worlds top stories as they happen.

programme.title: Biz Talk
programme.desc: A groundbreaking 30-minute interview show, giving an in-depth look into how top companies around the world conduct business and how policymakers view the fast-changing world economy. It presents 360 degree profiles of industry movers and shakers, tech mavericks and policymakers, and drills down on the stories behind their success, to give you clarity on what’s happening in every facet of business.

programme.title: The Agenda
programme.desc: A weekly talk-show looking beyond the headlines and “accepted wisdom” to find the real story. Hosted by award-winning journalist and presenter Stephen Cole, The Agenda quite simply sets The Agenda. You won’t find the same-old talking heads recycling platitudes; instead thought-provoking guests to debate and explore key issues of today’s world. Using virtual reality graphics to bring subjects to life, Stephen will navigate through subjects ranging from “Prove That Climate Change Exists” to “Who Will Win the Race to Space”. Opposing views will be given opportunity to flourish and develop into a meaningful conversation. The Agenda: No nonsense talk; Challenging perceptions.

programme.title: Razor
programme.desc: CGTNs brand new science and technology show, covering cutting edge developments from all over the world. RAZOR will show you the worlds most powerful laser and the worlds smallest anti-cancer treatment. It will take you from the weird world of quantum computing to the boundaries of the cosmos. An international team of reporters will follow the guidance of Occams Razor - the principle that the simplest explanation is the best one. RAZOR will show that we are already ""living in the future"!

programme.title: Chopped

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins And Dives: Triple D Nation
programme.desc: Guy Fieri grabs seconds of smoked bacon meatloaf in Atlanta, competition-style barbecue in Scottsdale, AZ, and a next-level burger in Fort Worth, TX.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins And Dives: Triple D Nation
programme.desc: Guy Fieri eats his way through out-of-bounds risotto in Atlanta, real deal relleno in Anthem, AZ, and succulent snapper in Arlington, TX.

programme.title: Symons Dinners: Cooking Out

programme.title: Symons Dinners: Cooking Out

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins, And Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri hunts desert and island flavour. He enjoys nostalgic breakfast tarts at a cafe in California and fish and chips at a gluten-free spot in Hawaii.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins, And Dives

programme.title: In Search Of Aliens
programme.desc: Giorgio Tsoukalos, an expert on H2’s ‘Ancient Aliens’, is continually asked to visit sites and speak about the topics covered in the series. This show explores the possibility of a spin-off series, with Giorgio himself as the featured talent.

programme.title: The Search For The Tesla Files
programme.desc: The team heads to Colorado Springs to search for the remains of Nikola Teslas mysterious laboratory and attempt to prove that Teslas design for generating wireless electricity actually works.

programme.title: Life After People
programme.desc: A range of geology, climatology and archaeology experts give their conclusions as to what life could be like on Earth if the human race dies out.

programme.title: Hunting Hitler
programme.desc: While investigating makeshift runways, the team finds reason to believe Hitler would had a stopping point on the way to Spain. Deep in the jungles of Argentina, Tim and Alasdair unearth clues that could make this area a Nazi militarized compound.

programme.title: Missing In Alaska
programme.desc: ‘Missing in Alaska’ investigates the region of northwest Alaska, where over 20,000 people have vanished in an area locals call the Alaska Triangle. In all these cases, the bodies are rarely discovered. Who or whats behind these cases is unknown.

programme.title: Gold Hunters: Legend Of The Superstition Mountains
programme.desc: A map of the dead reveals the teams next clue, but its in the most dangerous stretch of the Superstitions. Eric makes a discovery that spins the investigation in an entirely new direction.

programme.title: How The Earth Was Made
programme.desc: Historical clues and the expertise of geologists reveal how powerful forces shaped the planet.

programme.title: The Universe: Ancient Mysteries Solved
programme.desc: New technologies have suddenly revealed thousands of distant planets, opening up the most exciting period in astronomy in decades. Some believe were on the verge of answering the ancient question: are we alone in the universe?

programme.title: Rome: Rise And Fall Of An Empire
programme.desc: Emperor Theodosius enlisted Goth mercenaries to fight for the Empire, but how did he ensure loyalty? By giving command to the half-Vandal, half-Roman general, Stilicho.

programme.title: Lost Gold Of World War II
programme.desc: The team attempts to prove if a tunnel exists behind a unique formation of rocks they believe is a secret backdoor entrance into the mountain. Battling a typhoon and possible Nazi concrete, the team ultimately finds proof of a void 40 feet below.

programme.title: Digging For The Truth
programme.desc: Explorer Josh Bernstein takes a fresh look at the worlds greatest ancient mysteries, investigating and testing new theories using the latest technology.

programme.title: UFO Files
programme.desc: Investigate the facts and myths surrounding UFO sightings in every corner of the world. Examine evidence and eyewitness accounts and explore the mystery of what happened or what didnt happen.

programme.title: Missing In Alaska
programme.desc: The team investigates reports of a half-wolf, half-bear creature that may be prowling the Alaskan Triangle for victims.

programme.desc: ‘Warriors’ delves deep into the warrior mindset: the rites of passage, the initiations and the rituals, which reveal what makes them rise above the rest of humankind to lead, to fight, and in some cases, to die.

programme.desc: Host Bobby Bognar explores the popularity of Mexican food among Americans.

programme.title: Digging For The Truth
programme.desc: Explorer Josh Bernstein takes a fresh look at the worlds greatest ancient mysteries, investigating and testing new theories using the latest technology.

programme.title: UFO Files
programme.desc: Investigate the facts and myths surrounding UFO sightings in every corner of the world. Examine evidence and eyewitness accounts and explore the mystery of what happened or what didnt happen.

programme.title: Missing In Alaska
programme.desc: The team investigates reports of a half-wolf, half-bear creature that may be prowling the Alaskan Triangle for victims.

programme.title: Warriors
programme.desc: ‘Warriors’ delves deep into the warrior mindset: the rites of passage, the initiations and the rituals, which reveal what makes them rise above the rest of humankind to lead, to fight, and in some cases, to die.

programme.title: Food Tech
programme.desc: Host Bobby Bognar explores the popularity of Mexican food among Americans.

programme.title: How The Earth Was Made
programme.desc: Historical clues and the expertise of geologists reveal how powerful forces shaped the planet.

programme.title: Hunting Hitler
programme.desc: While investigating makeshift runways, the team finds reason to believe Hitler would had a stopping point on the way to Spain. Deep in the jungles of Argentina, Tim and Alasdair unearth clues that could make this area a Nazi militarized compound.

programme.title: Life After People
programme.desc: If people disappeared from Earth, what would happen to things made from metal? Would bridges and buildings collapse? Plus, what would become of the USs secret stash of gold?

programme.title: Cities Of The Underworld
programme.desc: Go beneath the busy streets to see the latest technology that will save the city from natural disasters and get an inside look at the secret life of the Ninja.

programme.title: The Universe
programme.desc: ‘The Universe’ examines how we know what we do about space; Mars, black holes and even if there is anywhere else out there that can sustain human life. This is the story of the scientists and explorers who dared to venture into uncharted territory.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: ‘Ancient Aliens’ examines 75 million years of the most credible alien evidence here on Earth, from the age of the dinosaurs to ancient Egypt to the skies over the western desert in present day USA.

programme.title: Battles BC
programme.desc: The great general leads his huge empire to India. Facing a challenging campaign in tough conditions, Alexanders plan requires tactical brilliance.

programme.title: Brad Meltzers Lost History
programme.desc: In partnership with the US National Archives, author and television host Brad Meltzer leads the hunt to retrieve historical and cultural treasures, and return them to their rightful owners: the American people.

programme.title: Lost Relics Of The Knights Templar
programme.desc: The most stunning relic in Hamilton and Carls collection - the black obsidian chalice - is examined. The pair then head to Portugal to hunt for clues about it.

programme.title: Hunting Hitler
programme.desc: While investigating makeshift runways, the team finds reason to believe Hitler would had a stopping point on the way to Spain. Deep in the jungles of Argentina, Tim and Alasdair unearth clues that could make this area a Nazi militarized compound.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens Special Presentation
programme.desc: Throughout human history, there have been sudden and dramatic leaps in our evolution that simply cannot be explained by Darwinian theory. Ancient Astronaut theorists propose that the “missing link” is extraterrestrial intervention.

programme.title: The UnXplained: Mysteries of the Universe
programme.desc: Weve been fascinated by our nearest planetary neighbor, Venus. Its about the same size as our world, covered in massive volcanoes and poisonous clouds of acid rain. Is Venus our evil twin or a warning about what Earth will become in the future?

programme.title: Pawn Stars Do America
programme.desc: Rick, Corey, and Chum are hitting the road to look for treasures in Tampa, Florida. Helming a crew of experts, the guys will plunder everything from Pokemon cards to Steve McQueens motorcycle, hoping to make waves in the Sunshine State.

programme.title: Curse of Skinwalker Ranch
programme.desc: An advanced radar experiment conducted high above the Mesa and Triangle reveals evidence appearing to support an incredible theory about Skinwalker Ranch.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: While new discoveries across the island continue to invigorate the team, a dangerous storm threatens to shut down the entire operation.

programme.title: The Unxplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: For decades, the debate has raged as to what exactly UFOs really are. Theories have attributed them to everything from military aircraft to weather phenomena. The most controversial theory is theyre ailen spacecraft. Could it be true?

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A seller walks into the shop hoping to score with his Magic Johnson 50th birthday invitation. Is the deal a slam dunk? Chum takes a look at joker cards used as props in "The Dark Knight." Will he play his cards right, or will the seller pull an act?

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick tackles a football helmet signed by 28 Heisman Trophy winners - but can he manage to get the sellers price a touch down? Then, Corey gears up to buy a devastatingly cool "Transformers" toy for the shop. Can he build a good deal?

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Puma Punku in Bolivia features some of the largest stone blocks on Earth, each carved with incredible precision. Could new advancements in technology help to solve a centuries old puzzle and offer proof of alien intervention on Earth?

programme.title: Curse of Skinwalker Ranch
programme.desc: When an indigenous sound ritual is performed on Skinwalker Ranch, the team members are amazed by the phenomena that are revealed.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: As the team makes contact with the elusive tunnel under the Garden Shaft, an exciting new scientific theory surfaces which suggests a connection between Nolans Cross and the Knights Templar.

programme.title: The Unxplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: Recent discoveries of ancient underground structures such as the city of Derinkuyu and the Malta Hypogeum suggest that there may be more down there, waiting to be discovered. If much of our past was subterranean, could our future be as well?

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick takes a trip down the rabbit hole after a seller hops in with a first edition of "Alices Adventures in Wonderland." Will it make Rick grin like the Cheshire Cat, or drive him mad?

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: When a seller whips into the shop with an "Energy Dome" hat made for the band DEVO, will Ricks offer top the charts? And later, Ricks intrigued by a signed George Washington letter. But will the asking price cause him to start a rebellion?

programme.title: The Proof Is Out There
programme.desc: Did a fisherman capture footage of a giant sea serpent known as "Caddy?" Whats the explanation for the mysterious blue and green flashing lights, witnessed by hundreds of people, in Lubbock, Texas in August of 1951?

programme.title: Mysteries Unearthed With Danny Trejo
programme.desc: From a Chinese curse that turns out to be real, to human remains in a Founding Fathers basement, or even a mysterious island in Central Asia with enough pathogens to kill the entire global population several times over.

programme.desc: Two thieves dressed as fake cops make off with a half-billion dollars worth of world-class artwork from a Boston museum. Although the paintings are still missing, numerous suspects turn up dead.

programme.desc: From asteroids and bursts of radiation to microscopic alien viruses, each one of these cosmic dangers may end human civilization as it is known.

programme.desc: Many of us fantasise about trying on a new identity, but when does the line between impersonation and transformation become blurred? Is it possible that by pretending to be someone else, a person can actually change their identity?

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Corey finds out if the force is with him when a seller brings two Star Wars Lego minifigures. Can he "C" his way to a deal, or will he run into a brick wall? Rick tries not to pop with excitement when he checks out a Jeff Koons Balloon Dog statue.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A set of replica Muppets has Chum green with envy; Will going gonzo over these furry friends land him the goods? When a pair of pants supposedly worn by Keith Richards rolls into the shop, Corey teaches Jake you cant always get what you want.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick sees red when a Rolex Submariner hits the counter. Will his offer make a splash, or is it just a waste of time? Meanwhile, Corey gets slap happy over a hockey stick signed by Paul Newman.

programme.title: Historys Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: Nicola Tesla is the epitome of what some would call the "mad scientist" and also one of historys biggest inventors. When Tesla died, he allegedly had 80 trunks of papers full of ideas. But only 60 of those were found. Where are the other 20?

programme.title: Historys Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: The gigantic statues of Easter Island have mystified humanity for centuries. How in the world did an ancient civilisation, with only primitive tools, carve and then move thousands of these rock monuments around the island… and why?

programme.title: Greatest Heists With Pierce Brosnan
programme.desc: Surfers by day, cat burglars by night, this trio of thieves is in New York to steal the priceless jewels at the American Museum of Natural History.

programme.desc: Rick, Corey, and Chum head to Louisville to bet on a collection of vintage spirits, a pair of goggles signed by Kentucky Derby jockey Jon Court, and a vintage pedal car. Later, they visit the Louisville Slugger factory, for a home run of a surprise.

programme.title: Greatest Heists With Pierce Brosnan
programme.desc: Surfers by day, cat burglars by night, this trio of thieves is in New York to steal the priceless jewels at the American Museum of Natural History.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world, a hungry Messy is searching for a sock to eat. He finds a delicious green sock under his bed but it’s covered in dust, he nibbles it anyway… “Aaa-chooo” sneezes Messy and his eyes begin to tear. “That’s weird,” says Messy, “I’m not sad and I haven’t hurt myself, so why is this wet stuff coming out of my eyes”. He vortexes himself to Okido to find out. Messy lands with a thud into Zoe and Felix’s sail boat which is bobbing along on the river. Zoe explains that the river has become so full of water that it’s flooded the streets of Okido.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: The girls call in Huckleberry to help design and build a new dog park for their puppies. To Huck’s dismay he finds himself in charge of a construction crew of Berrykins, who look up to him as an expert builder. They’re unaware that he is hiding a secret: all his life, everything he tries to build falls down. When he builds a wall that doesn’t fall, he attributes his success to a crystal good luck charm he found. He later learns it belongs to Cherry, who believes that its loss is what prevents her from singing high notes on key. Huck reluctantly returns it to her.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Nana is reading Harry a bedtime fairy story, but decides it is time for Harry to go to sleep before the story is finished.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Charlie wants to go to the circus but her Mum is unable to take her.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: A honey bee drops in on Leo’s picnic. The Junior Rangers buzz down to the forest to guide the honey bee back to its beehive, but an encounter with some wasps could prove too much for the Junior Rangers to handle.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Thomas is on his branch line when a passenger pulls the emergency cable and he has to stop quickly. But it turns out not to be an emergency at all, but a bird watcher who’s spotted a rare bird. To make matters worse, Clarabel has a wheel flat after being dragged along with her brakes on. So the next time Thomas sees the bird watcher he refuses to stop to collect him, but he soon learns that that’s not the right thing to do either.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Everyone is happy at Christmastime except for Duncan, who seems to be grumbling more than usual. Victor offers Duncan a new coat of paint if he can keep from grumbling for one day.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Grisu and Stella are supposed to draw water from an old well but they soon face several problems: the bucket they use is holed and when they manage to get a bucket full of water, the thirsty sheeps drink all. Not mentioning Fume who doesnt see the point of watering plants when you can do some dragon training. Grisu thinks he has found the perfect solution when he gets the idea of borrowing the firefighters water pump… until Fume (always the same old tune) burns it! But Grisu is never short of ideas. He manages to build a whole aqueduct and a funny pumping device to bring water from the river to the farm!

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Following Stellas suggestion, David and his team offer Grisu a very special day: the firefighters will involve him in their trainings. Delivering things with a drone, hitting targets with firehose water, going down the fire truck ladder while holding a bucket filled with water on ones head, navigating through a maze with lots of fun obstacles. Grisu does well in the proves, in spite of comic mishaps mainly caused by his dad. That is, until Grisu unwittingly burns the garage door switch and traps the firefighters and Fume inside, right as the siren goes off.But a firefighter never gives up!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare wakes early one Summer morning before the sun has risen. Big Nutbrown Hare sends Little Nutbrown Hare off to invite his friends for breakfast so he can rest a little longer. Along the way Little Nutbrown Hare discovers how wonderful and different all his friends homes are. Will Little Nutbrown Hare still love his own home as much as he did?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The series follows a warm father-son relationship that Little Nutbrown Hare decides he wants a clever long tail like his friends, rather than a short fluffy one. They help out by making him a long tail but all the results are either too tickly, bendy or flappy. When Big Nutbrown Hare spots his son from way across a grassy field everyone realizes that Little Nutbrown Hare’s little tail is clever in its own way.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Scoutbadger still has a soft toy, however this morning it is not in its usual place at the bottom of the bed. Scoutbadger has to find it but how can he search without revealing what he is looking for and perhaps having the others make fun of him?

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: When Bob and the team arrive at Chef Tattie’s fun new Milk Shake Bar, Scoop sees Chef Tattie experimenting with ingredients for his milk shakes and gets inspired. Scoop decides that he will do the same when he he helps Two-Tonne mix up the concrete for the Car Park. But the next morning, it’s soon clear that Scoop’s concrete isn’t dry. Scoop has to scrape it all off so they can start again. But Bob thinks there might be something to Scoop’s idea to make a fun car park after all and gives him some crazy but ‘proper’ materials to mix up in Dizzy.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Keen on Bob’s sardine sandwiches, Pilchard sneaks into his rucksack and hitches a ride to work at Chef Tattie’s UFO-themed revolving restaurant where she sneaks out and walks through some paint leaving a trail of green footprints. Inspired by all the talk of ‘aliens’, the Machines follow the trail. Pilchard arrives in the kitchen and goes to sleep on top of a remote control causing the restaurant to revolve at high speed. Bob saves the day by luring Pilchard off the remote control with a sardine sandwich. The team finish the restaurant and the Machines discover the truth about the ‘alien’ .

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: The Pig Twins discover a puddle full of stranded goldfish. Huckle and his pals try to solve the mystery of where they came from. It turns out they were blasted out of the park fountain when an obstruction in the drain hole suddenly got unplugged./ A mysterious message on Sgt. Murphy’s radio has Huckle and the gang baffled!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: The Junior Rangers invent a new mechanical leg for a Japanese Spider Crab.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Kyle claims to have discovered a brand new animal species - it has the fur and body of an otter, webbed feet and bill of a duck, and a tail like a beaver. Kylasaurus needs help!

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon and Gaspard start playing a game of Tag while Mummy and Daddy are asleep, but what starts out as a game between two becomes a game for the whole family!

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry the snailboy and Dolly the ladybird are the best friends ever. They’re having many pretty adventures in 3X13 short tales, while they make new friends and get knowledges about the world around them.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly 01 Mepe
programme.desc: The characters in the Berry and Dolly stories are a bunch of tiny bugs and beetles who live alongside one another in the forest. The stories are lead by the title characters: Berry the snail and Dolly the ladybird. A variety of other characters join them in their fun and games throughout the series with the stories set in their forest home. All the characters’ houses, belongings and clothes perfectly match their individual appearance.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry the snailboy and Dolly the ladybird are the best friends ever. They’re having many pretty adventures in 3X13 short tales, while they make new friends and get knowledges about the world around them.

A variety of other characters join them in their fun and games throughout the series with the stories set in their forest home. All the characters’ houses, belongings and clothes perfectly match their individual appearance.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: It turns out whether there are witches or not, and that it is not nice to frighten others.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry and Dolly goes to the kindergarten and the day passes fast with lot of interesting plays.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Balthazar really gets to like the unknown bumblebee girl, and with the help of the friends he even builds a house for her.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop are making ginger bunny biscuits for Charlie and Coco.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The series follows a pre-school bunny named Bing as he experiences the world around him. It uses small everyday occurrences to demonstrate how he learns new ways to manage situations with the help of his carer, Flop and friends. The programmes central phrase is "Its a Bing thing!" which Flop intones at the end of each episode when Bing has successfully conquered a troubling task or enjoyed a new childhood experience.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula are having so much fun playing together, they dont want to say goodbye.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: When Bing accidentally leaves his Hoppity Voosh toy at the park, Amma helps Bing focus and retrace his steps to find it.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Tilda is visited by her Great Great Aunt Emily. In honour of the occasion, all the friends have a game of Blind Mans Buff. Emily and Rupert have to take off their glasses. After the game, the two pairs of spectacles get mixed up and Emily and Rupert suddenly start suffering all manner of mishap: Rupert bites into an onion instead of an apple...

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: A new kind of biscuit has been delivered to the village shop and Molly would dearly love to know how they taste. Under Tildas alarmed gaze, she climbs up the counter on which the biscuit tin is standing, climbs inside – and when a gust of wind blows the lid shut, cant get out again. Horrified, Tilda rushes off to get help from Rupert.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Molly stands trembling at Tildas door: last night she heard noises in the village shop and then found an empty tin can. Its bound to have been a hungry ghost making trouble! That night, Tilda, Rupert, Molly and Edna lie in wait in the village shop to catch the ghost red-handed.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse befriend a little green caterpillar but arent prepared for the changes it will undergo.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: To earn his badge, Brewster has to stay clean while pulling a very messy load. It all goes wrong and he gets filthy – and the chugwash is broken! Koko comes to his rescue by suggesting that he washes himself clean in the Storm Maker. He cleans himself up, delivers his load – and earns his badge!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: A mother Zebra has lost its baby in a herd of migrating zebras! The Junior Rangers will have to spot it among the sea of stripes.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: When T’choupi and Nina find out there’s going to be a star shower visible in the sky tonight, they get very excited, and determined not to miss it! But they’re going to have to persuade their parents in order for that to happen… Not an easy feat: they’re way too young to stay up so late…

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi and Nina are excited to be looking after a guest - a friend’s "unique" rooster by the name of Rigoletto. They ask Fred what makes it so unique but he’s not sure; all he knows is that they need to take good care of it. However, despite being housed in its very own enclosure, Rigoletto escapes and goes missing!! Huh! Maybe the animal’s "uniqueness" will allow the kids to track it down…?

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Ciboulette the cat has stolen Fanni’s plush toy, making the little girl extremely sad. T’choupi and Nina are determined to get the toy back but the cat refuses to comply! After several vain attempts at approaching Ciboulette, the two friends receive unexpected assistance… from the chickens!.

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: The teacher has taken ill so a substitute comes to look after the class. But the boys all have fun at her expense: the little tricksters begin by giving her the wrong names and then tell her that they are allowed to play football all day rather than study!! The substitute seems rather surprised but lets them have their way… Will she remain this naïve for very long?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: The rain thwarts Sam and Julias play plans for the day. Since a rain is always followed by a rainbow, why not making one in order to push the rain stop falling? But how to make a rainbow?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Suspecting that each others life would be suits them better, Sam and Julia swap places for a few hours. But is Sams life really funnier than Julias? And her life calmer than Sams?

programme.title: Thomas and Friends
programme.desc: Stephen is the oldest engine on the Island of Sodor and people love to see him, so sometimes he makes special journeys round the island. He’s still called the Rocket, though he’s much slower than the other engines. Sometimes they have to slow down for him, which Gordon in particular doesn’t like. But it’s because Stephen travels so slowly that he notices that the Suspension Bridge is damaged and manages to alert the other engines in time to avoid a disaster!

programme.title: Thomas and Friends
programme.desc: Bertie, Thomas and Spencer get into a debate about how many wheels is best. Bertie has four wheels, Thomas has six and Spencer is very proud of his twelve. But when Spencer breaks down while taking the Duke and Duchess to Callan Castle, Thomas must transport his passengers instead. Then Thomas finds the track blocked and Bertie takes over. And when Bertie has a flat tyre who should turn up, but the Thin Controller on his bicycle. Surely the Duke and Duchess can’t ride to Callan Castle on his bike! Luckily, the Thin Controller has a better idea about how to help.

programme.desc: Its Little Field Mouses birthday and Little Nutbrown Hare wants to give her exactly the right gift. After a moment’s thought he realises he has no idea what to give her. programme.title: Sam And Julia

The Triplets plan its funerals and seem to be inconsolable. Maybe a new robot would cheer them up!

programme.title: The Triplets

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: When Mommy doesnt let Caillou buy a chocolate bar, he takes thingsinto his own hands - literally! He wrestles with his conscience andstruggles with the guilt of stealing, and learns a valuable lesson.

programme.desc: Marion has been digging along the mainline and is spending the night sleeping on a siding. A sound wakes her up and she sees a long line of dinosaurs going past in the moonlight! Marion thinks it must be a dream and tells Thomas as much the next day, but then the dinosaurs return and chase Marion all that way up to the castle. Eddie takes it off to the repair shed and Emery, wanting to be helpful, takes its place. But, worried that he might miss something, Emery sends nearly everyone to the repair shed, creating chaos in the depot! Emery feels bad that he’s caused so much work for Vee and wishes he could make up for it. He has an idea. If the detector could talk, it wouldn’t have to do everything through Vee. Dr. Ling and Eddie think it’s a great idea and they update the detector so that it speaks. And they know the perfect voice to use - Emery’s!

programme.title: Chuggington 04
programme.desc: Eddie is having a very busy day and Hodge really wants to help - but all the jobs need hands not wheels. When Wilson reports the track lift is malfunctioning, Hodge decides to try to fix it himself. He only makes matters worse, bringing the lift to a grinding halt with Wilson stuck on it! Eddie agrees to let Hodge go and fetch the lift part needed, as long as he uses Dr Ling’s Chugnav to guide him on his journey. Unfortunately, Action Chugger has knocked the satellite, which has skewed the signal, leaving the Chugnav talking utter nonsense!
