programme.desc: Bing has enough money to buy one thing in Padgets shop but he finds it hard to choose between all the lovely things. After much deliberation Bing chooses a campervan but on the way home he begins to regret his decision.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Its bedtime but wheres Hoppity? Bing remembers playing with him in the garden so Flop finds a torch and together they set off in the dark for an adventure.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: If you get stuck, you need some help and then you can get down by yourself.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The bunnys friends gather for a cake party.

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Oswald discovers an old polka dot umbrella while walking in Big City Park. Not needing an umbrella on such a hot sunny day, Oswald decides to find its owner, but after asking several people with no luck, Oswald resigns himself to the fact that he should keep it. However, the umbrella comes in very handy as the hot sunny day turns into a very wet and rainy day.

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: On a lovely sunny day, Oswald, Weenie, Daisy and Henry decide to go camping. They prepare for the adventure and pack all the things necessary for the trip. Henry doesn’t like the look of the weather and takes no risks, packing everything waterproof from galoshes to umbrellas. They eventually find the perfect spot to pitch the tent when it starts to pour! Henry, delighted at being proved right, starts unpacking his gear, only to see it blown away by the wind. Realising that the trip is a wash out they make their way home and decide to pitch their tent – indoors!

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob tells a tired Scoop to stay behind at Bobs Yard as he goes to build an ice-cream kiosk at the beach. Scoop keeps finding spurious reasons to radio Bob and make him return to the yard. Finally there’s a real crisis but Bob doesnt believe its anything serious. Scoop takes a burning bin to the beach where it falls on the kiosk roof. Scoop saves the kiosk by scooping sand onto the roof.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Mayor Madison has commissioned a skate park so that the Spring City Rockets can enter an online action sports video. As Bob and the team set to work building it, Scoop, Muck and Lofty ask Leo if he can skate. Although he’s never actually set foot on a board, Leo gets swept up in the moment and boasts that he’s an amazing skateboarder, nicknamed “Lightning Leo”. When Brandon announces that they need one more rider to join them in the video (competition rules) Dizzy is keen to have a go, demonstrating her skill on four wheels. But the machines insist Lightning Leo should be in it... and suddenly Leo finds himself slated for a “Battle of the Boards” contest with Dizzy once the skate park has been completed. He dashes off to buy a skateboard kit (including an action camera), and returns to the park to practice.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: On Summer’s hottest night Little Nutbrown Hare finds it hard to sleep. When a swim in the river isn’t enough to cool him down, Little Nutbrown Hare and his friends ask Little White Owl to tell them a really cold and sleepy bedtime story. Will she come up with a story that can make them feel cool and finally get Little Nutbrown Hare off to sleep?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare is impressed by Blue Bird’s description of a flowery field that looks just like a sea of colour from her bird’s eye view. He visits the field with Big Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse, and they discover that everyone has their own unique view of the field, and each one is special in its own way.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One gorgeous Summer morning Big Nutbrown Hare wakes to find Little Nutbrown Hare enthralled by a story of Little White Owl’s. Encouraged, Little Nutbrown Hare sets off to make up a story of his own, but finds it harder than he thought to come up with one. With the help of his father, he finally uses some fruit he’s collected on the way to help him tell a very colourful tale.

programme.title: Learning Time With Timmy
programme.desc: Timmy and Finlay build Otus an enormous castle with colourful flags. What colour are the flags?

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Someone in Busytown Park got rid of Sally and Hildas newly drawn hopscotch board. Huckle and Lowly set about helping the girls find out whos responsible. As it turns out the culprit isnt a who, but a what - the parks new sprinkler system washed the chalk drawing clean off the sidewalk./ Mr. Gronkle’s great great grandfather has hidden a priceless treasure somewhere and it’s up to Huckle and the gang to find it.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world, Messy is fascinated by a goldfish swimming around in its bowl. “How do you stay under water for so long” he asks but there’s no response from the fish apart from a line of bubbles, which Messy watches rise to the surface. “When you need to know go to Okido” he cries. In Okido, Messy joins Zoe and Felix in the garden where they’re looking at all their favourite finds gathered in a treasure chest. Messy’s attention immediately turns to a golden-shiny-round-thing that glistens golden in the sunlight.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world Messy is about to have his favourite snack – a pair of socks! He quickly gulps down the first delicious sock and then reaches out for the second but he can’t find it. “It’s got to be here somewhere, but why can’t I see it?” He says. A puzzled Messy transports himself to Okido to find out. Messy lands in Okido and startles at the sight of a ginormous multi-coloured paper model monster. “We made it for you” giggle Zoe and Felix as they appear from behind their hiding places.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: The girls plan a formal afternoon lawn party tea with their puppies to inaugurate their new dog park. With the girls dressed in formal gowns and hats that Raspberry has made, and the pups wearing their new high fashion collars, the gates open. For some strange reason the puppies won’t go into the dog park! They back away with worried whines. All the girls except Strawberry begin jumping to conclusions about what could be causing the problem. Each has a pet theory which they demonstrate to the others—tempting the pups with treats, changing the park’s scents, repainting its colors. Nothing works.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry decides he wants to be a zookeeper when he grows up, but he cant wait until then so he opens his very own zoo in Dino-World.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: When a letter addressed to a Mr. Snow is delivered to Harrys house, Harry concludes that Mr. Snow must live in Dino-World.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: A barn owl scares Leo in the garden. The Junior Rangers depart for the grasslands to find a better hunting place for the barn owl.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Duncan is the grumpiest engine on the narrow gauge railway. He is always complaining about one thing or another. But when Duncan gets a very grumpy passenger, Duncan finds his grumpiness very annoying. So he decides to do everything he can to make the grumpy passenger stop complaining. But Duncan soon learns that you can’t make everyone happy.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: It is Christmas Eve and a lot of passengers are coming home to Sodor for the holiday. Connor can’t carry all the passengers who are trying to get on his train. He promises to come back and collect them, but the snow keeps falling and the engines are struggling to keep the track clear. It becomes a race against time and all the engines have to work together to clear the tracks and get the passengers home in time for Christmas.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Professor Smeraldos car accidentally ran into an obelisk in the desert, which now may fall down. It has to be straightened back up fast, as it threatens to tip over. Grisu offers to come help him out and operate a nearby crane to fix up the monument. But Smeraldo gives him wrong instructions by mistake and the crane nearly ends up in the river. Ensue a series of mishaps, such as Smeraldo being chased by a crocodile, and saved by Grisu and his sandwich. Grisu finally manages to put a strap linked to the crane around the obelisk. But as the young dragon is about to operate the crane and pull on the obelisk tip, the crocodile shows up again.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Because he has unintentionally caused an accident and slightly injured Toramento, Grisu suggests replacing him in his job which is to unload and load Oliviers boat. Unfortunately, Grisu, distracted by his father, makes a big mistake as he confuses the boats and unloads and loads the bad one (Smeraldos boat.) In the end, he burns the forklift... Fortunately, he finds an original solution by creating a kind of suspended train, hanging on the streetlamps (like a car assembly line).

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One Summer’s day Little Field Mouse is very excited to show Little Nutbrown Hare her new favourite thing, a very pretty flower… the prettiest ever! She lets Little Nutbrown Hare borrow it to show Big Nutbrown Hare, but when it blows away during the night Little Nutbrown Hare worries how his friend will react. Will he be able to work up the courage to tell her what happened?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Trying to keep cool on a sticky Summer’s day by the stream, Little Nutbrown Hare and Big Nutbrown Hare have lots of fun skipping stones and throwing sticks. When Little Nutbrown Hare discovers that sticks float, the two follow the sticks down the river to see where they go. It’s not an easy chase, and there is a surprise around every corner. Where will the sticks end up?

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: The children want to give their parents a portrait of them which is much more flattering than reality. But aren’t imperfections part of what we like about others ?

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and the team will be building an enclosure and viewing platform for the new giraffe. Lofty is excited that he will be seeing his favourite animal. But when the giraffe arrives he gets so anxious to get a good view that he crashes through a fence and frightens the giraffe away! Luckily he knows exactly what giraffes eat and is soon tempting the giraffe back to his enclosure with a big pile of leaves on his jib. The enclosure is finished and tidied up just in time and Bob suggests Jenny Dobbs names the giraffe after it’s biggest fan… Lofty!

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and his gang are installing new barriers and laying a new paved driveway at FIxham Town Hall; at the end of the day a statue of Mayor Madison will be unveiled in the new driveway. Scoop is fitted with his pneumatic breaker and gets overexcited while using it, resulting in him breaking an underground water pipe and causing it to leak. While Bob and Wendy have some difficulty installing the barrier, Scoop covers up the leak and gets Muck to stand over the hole thus blocking the water from escaping. When Muck moves from this position Scoop speeds back to hide his mistake and causes Lofty to drop the paving slabs. The slabs are shattered! Scoop remarks on them looking like jigsaw pieces – giving Bob the idea of using the broken slabs to make crazy paving.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: The kids find some numbered papers blowing around the park. After investigating several possibilities of where they could be from, they finally figure out they were once fastened to trees in the park as part of a self-guided tour to celebrate Arbor Day. / When all the milk in Huckle’s Dad’s store turns out to be sour, Huckle, Sally and Lowly set out to find out why.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Oh no! Someone is stung by the Brazilian Yellow Scorpion!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Peyo is stuck in a tree with an Anaconda hanging right above him. Can the Junior Rangers get to him in time?

programme.title: Simon

programme.desc: Berry and Dolly accidentally ruin the snowman of Balthazar but finally they build an even nicer one jointly.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The violin of the poor Cricket breaks. Berry and Dolly takes care that neither the Cricket nor the other animals remain without instrument and music.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Dolly helps Christopher, the canary who broke his wing. In gratitude Christopher takes Dolly to the island where the yellow ladybird lives.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry visits his distant relative, Snail Sam.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry the snailboy and Dolly the ladybird are the best friends ever. They’re having many pretty adventures in 3X13 short tales, while they make new friends and get knowledges about the world around them.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop are finally ready to leave for their picnic just as it starts to rain.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula invent a noisy game with a helium balloon they find stuck in a tree.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Coco discovers Bing’s dressing up box so they both dress up. Coco is Princess Cococapono and Bing is, of course, King Bing. programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing makes Sula a picture with all her favourite things on it. It just needs one last jewel stuck on but oops the glue spills all over the picture. Sparkles save the day.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: A tiring gardening session make the friends of Wild Rose Lane dream of going away on holiday. But none of them wants to be all alone in far-off places. So Tilda suggests that they simply swap homes. No sooner said than done! Tilda moves in to Ednas, Molly to Ruperts, Robin to Tildas, the squirrels to Mollys and Rupert to Robins.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: While Tilda is having a picnic by the river with her friends, Snaily creeps into the garden to look for food. He sees another snail that has fallen asleep on the wall of the house and is threatening to dry out. Courageously, Snaily saves the other snail, but in doing so gets trapped under a bucket.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: When Tilda one morning wakes up especially early, she is visited by Robin. He tells her that he as a robin wakes the sun every morning and invites Tilda to join him the following day. For this, however, Tilda has to get up at half past four! That evening, shes so excited she has difficulty going to bed early.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse are inspired to make a spider’s web, but run into all sorts of comic trouble when they do.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: When Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse find a strange set of prints in the snow and hunt for the owner, their imaginations run away with them

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare discovers he cant fit under his favourite hiding log anymore. With Big Nutbrown Hares help, he learns he has grown bigger since last Spring, and can now clamber into a hole in a tree thats an even better hiding place. Big Nutbrown Hare learns that you are never too young to play.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: Wilson already knows how to honk, but Emery is testing him to make sure he knows when to honk. Wilson gets a bit mixed up and fails his first attempt – but when he encounters a broken signal light at a tunnel entrance, his honking saves the day! Since he’s proved he knows how to use his horn correctly in an emergency, he wins his badge after all.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: The Junior Rangers help a Galapagos tortoise - which can weigh more than a fridge - flip back on its feet.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: A Siberian Chipmunk has stolen Kais smell capsule which holds the smell of a very, very rare animal. What could it be?

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Today is "picnic in the forest day!" And T’choupi and his friends are going to be riding there on their bicycles. Yay, how exciting!... Except, for some reason, Nina doesn’t seem too enthusiastic about it… That’s strange – what could possibly be the matter?: she loves going to the forest and is always up for adventure! She agrees to go in the end, albeit reluctantly. But before long, T’choupi discovers her "shameful secret…"

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: When he finds out that today is Nina’s birthday, T’choupi is eager to give her a surprise! And what could be better than have Dad bake one of his yummy cakes?! But to pull it off, they’re going to have to collect eggs and pick strawberries in the hamlet without Nina noticing. And given how eager she is to play with T’choupi, this is no easy feat! When she notices T’choupi is acting mysterious and distant all of a sudden, she even gets a bit annoyed, not to say offended…

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi is proud to have been put in charge of feeding Nina’s animals while she’s away. But when he accidentally drops some eggs and commits a series of blunders, the animals change their behavior, and even seem to start avoiding him! Are they upset with T’choupi for being so clumsy?

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: Charley and Jane come upon a shivering little bird in the schoolyard. To please her pupils, Shelley agrees to build it a shelter. Once they get it set up, the little bird is nowhere to be seen, it’s as if he has no interest in it whatsoever… Unless some other inhabitant has settled inside the shelter instead…

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam and Julia unintentionally damaged Ellas favorite doll. How can they repair it and put it back at her place without Ella realizing? It seems they have to develop a lot of skills to do so.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Ella never had the golden ball that the baker hides every year in a cheese puff and that is supposed to bring luck. Ella thinks it should be her turn. Except that Julia has never had it either...

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: The feather of a rare bird brought back from Julias island escapes from her own hands and flies towards the stairwell. A chase begins in the various air currents, involving Sam and Julia.

programme.title: Thomas and Friends
programme.desc: On match days Thomas is a very popular engine, because the Sodor football team wear blue. One match day a mainland team come to the island wearing red, and they cheer James because he is red too. Soon the two engines are competing with each other over who can bring the fans to the match faster. But by refusing to pick up supporters wearing the wrong colours, James ends up leaving the rival football team at the station since they are not yet wearing their kit and Thomas rushes right past the Fat Controller who is supposed to be the match referee. In all the confusion and delay there might not be a match at all!

programme.title: Thomas and Friends
programme.desc: When Emily breaks down and disrupts a race between Connor and Caitlin, Caitlin shunts Emily to the castle causing Emily to travel faster than she ever has been before. Emily is in awe of Caitlin, who she believes is the best engine ever and becomes disheartened at her own ability. But when Caitlin’s brakes fail, Emily races to save her from an accident proving that she too can be a Really Useful Engine.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou and his scout troop are assigned an almighty task - a beachclean! It soon seems too much, how can they clean ALL the trash?But Caillous imagination saves the day.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Detective Caillou investigates the case of the missing bouncy ball -and everyone in the family is a suspect!

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: The new yellow t-shirt that Sally planned on wearing for her portrait painting has mysteriously turned green. Huckle and Lowly help Sally look for clues as to how this colour-change happened. They discover that mixing different colours results in the creation of a new one. It turns out that the dye from a blue blanket turned the yellow shirt green in the washing machine. / The kids discover pieces of a large metal hand, Huckle and gang are determined to find out to whom they belong.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Monkey finds it is hard to build a sand castle and keep it whole especially when someone constantly makes holes in it… When monkey realizes that the naughty digger is his friend the Crab, monkey decides it is time for his favorite game… “Monkey See Monkey Do”!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Mandy wants to be the fastest delivery person ever! Her dad upgrades her scooter, and she speeds through her deliveries… until she hits a bump, loses her brakes, and needs to be rescued before she gets to the cliffs!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: When Tom Thomas tries to help the Pioneers earn their bird watching badges using a fancy new APP, his phone obsession causes him to tumble over a cliff! Without Tom to fly the helicopter, it’s up to a mysterious new character to save the day…

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: Lizzy and Lauren arrange a horse riding lesson for Ben, and Pat brings Pumpkin the pony.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Sitting at the table with her family, Rosie is talking about how she is looking forward to her wonderful holidays with her father. But the little vixen is surprised by the lack of attention of her two brothers, too busy talking about their own holidays. Soon, Rosie feels left out and is worried that the twins might forget her. To prevent this from happening, she becomes very clingy. Singing, making fishing rods, drawing… Rosie is alwaysaround. So much so that it starts to annoy her brothers.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Berry sees a shooting star in the sky and makes a wish to become a princess, Princess Berry. To spare her from being disappointed, Rosie, Scoutbadger and Woodsy pretend that she has indeed really become a princess. But Princess Berry turns out to be a very demanding princess…

programme.title: Doodleboo

programme.desc: With just a few strokes of his pencil, Doodleboo always manages to do a funny drawing that comes to life as soon as it has been coloured.

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave go in search of the biggest number in Number Land. They learn that there is always a bigger number than any number they can think of.

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: In an exciting game of opposites, Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave discover that "opposite" means ‘most different, and explore pairs of words that describe opposite states and actions.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare keeps winning a game with Little Field Mouse, and enjoys it so much he doesnt realise she is frustrated with losing. Big Nutbrown Hare helps him realise that winning is less important than making sure everyone enjoys playing the game. So Little Nutbrown Hare invents a new game that Little Field Mouse and her twin siblings can enjoy playing too.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Days On a hot Summer’s day Big Nutbrown Hare wants the young ones to have some relaxing time by the river. Like most young kids they have trouble staying quiet and still. When they do finally manage some quiet time, they experience the variety of life that the river has to offer, including some rare birds and a family of terrapins.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare wakes up to a colourful sprig of holly in the snow outside the hollow log. It’s surprise gift from Little Spotty Deer, who has returned to the meadow. This gives Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse the idea to spread the joy and surprise all their other friends with a holly sprig too, so the three of them make a game of it. Theme: Spreading fun and joy.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Sula and Bing tag all their favourite things around the house with stickers, but when Sula tags Hoppity Voosh Bing is upset because he doesnt want to share.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing wants Flop to read him a story when he has his bath but gets sad when his book gets wet. Flop helps him to understand that even though the book is wet, the story isnt.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing has a great time choosing the perfect present for Sula in Padgets shop. Its a wand and is sparkly and flashy and spinny and Bing knows that she will love it. Bing is thrilled until it is time to hand the present over.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing wants to try Coco’s Hula Hoop. It’s harder than it looks but he finds lots of other hoopy games as he tries. Just as Bing almost gets it right he gets carried away with spinning, trips over and breaks the hoop. Coco is upset that she can’t hula anymore until Bing and Charlie remind her of all the other games they can still do with the bent hoop.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula are in the park playing at being giants and splashing in puddles with their big welly boots. programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The forest friends go for a walk in the forest, but Bubbles cant stop hiccupping. His friends try to help him by giving all sorts of advice. To eat, drink, hold his breath... But none of them seem to help. Finally, Stanley scares Bubbles from behind the tree. The hiccup stops, but now Bubbles is offended by Stanley. They all make amends later, after Stanley saves Bubbles from slipping into the creek.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The forest friends decide to help the Millerbug fix his broken windmill, but the wind doesnt seem to be blowing. Zephyr goes on to save the day, by asking the Wind to help the group restart the mill. Finally, the Millerbug can prepare his delicious bread.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: Zephyr and Leapy decide to make a little surprise box for Dr Owls most beloved belongings. They want to decorate the box with shells, so the Robin flies them to the seashore to collect the most beautiful shells. They even get some help from the Crab, and get a ride back home on a back of a turtle.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: One day Stanley gets a silver robot from Frank as a present. The robot can move, make sounds and also flash its lights. programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Baby Sadies dolly has mysteriously gone missing somewhere between home and the band shell in Busytown Park. programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Norman tries to finish his Sea Life Spotting project but ends up stranded in a cave by rising tides. Sam pilots Juno to rescue him just in time.

programme.title: Kipper

Pig can’t believe its Arnold hurtling towards him on his return – a better bike rider than Pig will ever be.

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: Pig is very proud of his new purple woolly sweater and shows it off to Kipper. Arnold spots a big red arrow, and then another, and they follow them into the woods. Pig doesn’t notice he has caught his sweater on a branch. The arrows were Tiger’s idea and he laughs at them from a tree he’s hiding in. Then he realises they’re lost. The unravelled wool from Pig’s sweater leads them back home.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Nina is sure that her dog Loupiote is the fastest animal around! But T’choupi believes Brocoli the goat can move even faster! Nina rises to the challenge, and before you know it, Loupiote and Brocoli are unknowingly competing with each other in a race! But the dog and goat do whatever they please. And when Ciboulette the cat gets involved, it’s all downhill from there!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Tchoupi loves eating Fred’s goat’s cheese… but thinks again after getting a whiff of the goats’ pen: Ew!... So he’s very happy when Nina suggests they clean it out! Once they’re done with the cleaning, the two friends decide they could also make it more cozy. But shhh, not a word to anyone: it’s a surprise! However, after making the pen all spic and span and super comfortable, they’re shocked to find that the smell is still there!?! Thinking he’s found the perfect solution, Tchoupi sprays Mom’s perfume inside the pen… But what do the goats’ think of this new scent inside their house…?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Edna asks Rupert to look after her sons Billy and Benny. No problem, thinks Rupert. They can play while he reads a book. But no sooner has Rupert sat down in his armchair than the little squirrels turn up with one request after another. First they want lunch, then they need to go to the loo, then they want to play.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: The Triplets stumble upon an ice-cream vendor at the beach and ask their Mom for one, but the answer is no! The same thing happens in front of a toy store and a swimming pool store. Mom is starting to find her kids quite capricious, so she tells them the incredible story of a boy whose parents gave him every single thing he asked for.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: The Triplets and Kiko decide to have a funny-face contest, but Grandpa warns them: if the wind blows in your direction your face might get stuck that way your whole life. The Kids are totally panicked and want to find out if it is true. Poet and Turbulent make Kiko believe that his face got stuck but then Grandpa plays the same trick on them. Poet and Turbulent sheepishly hide behind lampshades. Good thing it was only a joke!

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Scoutbadger goes for a walk with Rosie and her father, Basil. During the walk, Scoutbadger discovers that the flamboyant Basil, who tells him stories that fire his imagination, is more at ease with the tales he tells than with reality.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou and Leo visit the beach and build sand castles, play frisbee, and paddleboard!

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou has been tasked with reading Rosie a bedtime story. Hetells her classic fairytales, with a Caillou-twist, but gets tooexcited and spooks her with stories of bears and wolves - wakingRosie up instead of putting her to sleep. Finally, he gets luckywhen he combines all the tales into one special story.

programme.title: Thomas and Friends
programme.desc: The first time Samson came to Sodor he got lost. But Samson is a very proud engine and he doesn’t like to admit his mistakes. So he finds it very hard to listen to the other engines trying to warn him that he is making a mistake again when he accidentally takes Gordon’s Express Coaches to the quarry, instead of the trucks used for carrying stone.

programme.title: Chuggington 04
programme.desc: Koko decides to try for the High Speed badge - something no trainee has ever won. Emery wishes he still earned badges like the trainees do. For fun, he plays a "pretend badge" game with Hoot and Toot, where they award each other imaginary badges. Emery is so busy playing his game that he doesn’t listen when Vee assigns him to take some supporters to the footbridge to cheer Koko on. Realising that he was so wrapped up in his pretend badge game, he forgot how important the real badge was for Koko, he takes it upon himself to be her number one cheerleader.

programme.title: Chuggington 04
programme.desc: Toot doesn’t want to do track inspection with Hoot. To get out of it, she pretends she isn’t feeling well. At first she enjoys getting lots of attention, but when Morgan thinks her flywheel needs replacing, which means having her engine taken out and spending the night in the repair shed, Toot realises she’s gone too far. She confesses that there’s nothing wrong with her - she just didn’t want to do the track inspection! Toot realises she has caused a lot of trouble for everyone and promises never to do it again. She and Hoot head off to do the track inspection. Actually, It turns out to be really fun and Toot realises she was making a fuss over nothing.

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: Charley and Jane come upon a shivering little bird in the schoolyard. To please her pupils, Shelley agrees to build it a shelter. Once they get it set up, the little bird is nowhere to be seen, it’s as if he has no interest in it whatsoever… Unless some other inhabitant has settled inside the shelter instead…

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave help Littlest Bunny prepare for his first Easter Egg Hunt. Together they collect eggs from Penny Hen, decorate them and choose the best hiding places in Hatty’s garden. Making sure all their friends get to find an egg, they offer clues on where to find them - and Hatty finds perfect hiding places for four special eggs, just for Ruff-Ruff, Tweet, Dave and Littlest Bunny!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi is sad when he learns that Plume the rabbit has hurt her paw. He and Nina decide to take their little furry friend into T’choupi’s bedroom: she’ll be safe in there and able to get a good rest while they take good care of her. T’choupi’s certain this is a good solution. But little does he know… cheeky little Plume has other ideas…!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Who’s that hopping into the garden? Why, it’s a yellow-footed rock-wallaby—and its baby! The Junior Rangers hightail it to Australia to send mother and child home, but will a couple of flat tires throw a spanner in the works?

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry the snailboy and Dolly the ladybird are the best friends ever. They’re having many pretty adventures in 3X13 short tales, while they make new friends and get knowledges about the world around them.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry, Dolly, Stanley, Balthazar, Flutter and Bubble are hiking in the forest on a beautiful autumn day. Suddenly they recognized that someone is crying in the bush. They found a mushroom without his hat. The friends immediately start to help him.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: One spring day, Frank longhorn beetle visits his friend, Stanley. Frank suggests to organize a football match. Everyone wants to play football, the two teams get together quickly. The girls cheer on the sidelines. The game is about to start.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Easter is here. The girls: Dolly, Flutter, Leapy, Zephyr and Rosita gather and start to paint the Easter eggs. They happily work all day, painting beautiful eggs.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: One night Berry is already in his bed, when he hears some strange noise. First he doesnt care, but the noise just getting louder. Finally he opens the door when the little green worm appeared. Long time no see friend just arrived.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing wants to get dizzy on the roundybout so Pando pushes him. Its not long before Bing realises that some dizzy is fun but too much dizzy is not fun at all.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing builds a house out of sofa cushions and Coco decides its perfect for a game of Big Bad Wolf. Bing enjoys being wolfie until hes not allowed into the house he built.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: It’s a hot day and Bing and Flop buy an ice lolly from Gilly the ice cream lady. Before they can eat them a frog hops into Bing’s paddling pool and they go to the rescue. By the time they return to the ice lollies all that’s left are the sticks and a plate of lolly goo.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing gets very enthusiastic when he and Sula paint a mural and his painting starts to drop all over Sulas. Sula is upset until she realises that the painting isnt spoiled, its just different.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing gets stuck when he takes a game of hide-and-seek too far.

programme.title: Bing Bunny - Shorts and characters
programme.desc: Get to know our little pets better through charming stories featuring the characters from the popular Bing series.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: It’s Christmas eve and big snow flakes are falling from the sky. Simon is afraid that Santa Claus won’t be able to drive his sled in this weather. So once he’s in bed, Simon wakes up his little brother Gaspard: they’re going to help Santa Claus land his sleigh by making a landing strip in the yard, with strings of lights. The next morning there are piles of presents under the Christmas Tree. Thank-you who? Thank-you Simon!

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Rosie would like to spend a night alone, without Berry. Edmund and Margaret suggest that she sleeps, just for one night, in the guest room. Berry is not happy about this and asks her brothers for help.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse are inspired to make a spider’s web, but run into all sorts of comic trouble when they do.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: When Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse find a strange set of prints in the snow and hunt for the owner, their imaginations run away with them

programme.title: Boribon
programme.desc: Racing is exciting, but not for everyone. When Boribon feels sad because he hasnt won first place, Annalee cleverly finds a way to cheer the little bear up.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Ella never had the golden ball that the baker hides every year in a cheese puff and that is supposed to bring luck. Ella thinks it should be her turn. Except that Julia has never had it either...

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: The feather of a rare bird brought back from Julias island escapes from her own hands and flies towards the stairwell. A chase begins in the various air currents, involving Sam and Julia.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: Its Grandfathers birthday! The Triplets want to give him an amazing present, Girl wants to offer him a rake for his garden, Poet a big hat and Turbulent wants to bought a race car. Unfortunately and despite their willingness, the Triplets dont have enough money! On Mommys good advice, they decide to team up to buy Grandfather the most amazing gift. Their choice goes for a beautiful tie which they buy and wrap up. Everything is ready for Grandfathers birthday, but thats without counting on Totos appetite.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: At dinnertime, Mommy announces to the Triplets there is a new neighbor in the building. She asks them to go welcoming her and invite her for coffee. However, Madam Gzell, the neighbor, is absolutely not a nice person. She welcomes the Triplets really harshly, all she worries about is her sick baby. When they learn there is a new baby in the building, all the Triplets want, its to play with him. But Madam Gzell is really mysterious, no one can see her "baby"! The investigation is on !

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: Sub-zero temperatures are causing problems for the chuggers. The docks are covered by thick fog and the haulers can’t get out with their deliveries on the treacherous tracks. It also means that no cargo ships will be able to dock today. Jackman has the Chug Patrollers out early gritting the tracks. When the Working Wheels Yard runs out of diesel, Vee declares an emergency and all diesel engines are grounded. The only place that still has a supply of diesel is the docks.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Norman tries to finish his Sea Life Spotting project but ends up stranded in a cave by rising tides. Sam pilots Juno to rescue him just in time.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: When Norman and new boy Peter get lost at sea, Krystyna must pilot the new rescue plane and save them before their ship sinks!

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: Pig asks Kipper to look after Arnold and says he’s really tired so he won’t be any trouble. Kipper reads to him, makes a house under the table, turns a cardboard box into a railway engine, but by the time Pig returns, it’s Kipper who can’t keep his eyes open.

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: Kipper can’t understand where the contents of his cereal packet have gone, or why, when he know he put them away, his toys are littered all over the place. Then he discovers he’s got a little visitor – and life may never be the same again.

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D) Mepe
programme.desc: While playing in his backyard, Caillou grows curious after hearing his parents laughing inside. Pretending to be a secret agent, he tries to sneak away to join the fun. But when the agent is caught by the evil Professor Meow (Gilbert), Caillou learns that when he’s curious about something, he should just ask.

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D) Mepe
programme.desc: Rosie wants to play Monster Tracker with Caillou but, worried she might get hurt, he refuses. He then pretends to be a monster tracker trying to keep his junior partner (Rosie) safe. After Junior saves the monster tracker, Caillou decides to invite Rosie to play with him safely.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: A new tunnel-boring machine called Darcy arrives on Sodor. She has come to work on the new road being built by Miss Jenny’s Construction Crew and is eager to impress her new friends. She makes several mistakes, and worries she doesn’t fit in with the other engines. Nia encourages Darcy to be herself and she soon makes up for her mistakes when everyone sees what she can really do!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Can the Junior Rangers train a timid Caracal to be independent in the wild?

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: A Lioness is trapped in a cave! Can the Junior Rangers help reunite her with her pride?

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: Pat’s mission today is to collect donations towards the brand new Greendale Website. There’s lots and lots to do and all kinds of obstacles for Pat along the way.. it’s a long day for Pat – but he’s rewarded when the Website goes live e and as a special present the children have prepared a special tribute to Pat.

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: Its Diwali and Nisha wants to decorate the cafe with special fairy lights to celebrate.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The series follows a pre-school bunny named Bing as he experiences the world around him. It uses small everyday occurrences to demonstrate how he learns new ways to manage situations with the help of his carer, Flop and friends. The programmes central phrase is "Its a Bing thing!" which Flop intones at the end of each episode when Bing has successfully conquered a troubling task or enjoyed a new childhood experience.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Pando are both tired but insist on one last game of Hide and Seek before bed. Pando finds a great hiding place under the covers of Bing’s bed but by the time Bing finds him he’s fast asleep. Bing is tired too and gets upset when he thinks there’s nowhere left for him to sleep, but Flop and Padget find a way.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula help Amma to get lunch ready. Bing watches yummy peas and delicious carrots go into the pot, but when lunch is served theyre all mixed up together and Bing doesnt like it.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing falls in love with a lost dog he and Flop find in the park and decides he wants to keep her. When the owner turns up Bing is very upset when it comes to saying goodbye to his new friend.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: When the children make Eggy heads with eggs and cress seeds, Bing gets impatient and wants his cress to grow quicker so he decides to give Eggy lots of water with the garden hose.

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Weenie is playing with her favourite toy, a ball of yarn, when it bounces out of the flat and starts unravelling. Oswald and Weenie chase it through the streets as the yarn ties up virtually all of Big City. After Oswald finally catches the now tiny ball, he finds that everyone is having fun with the yarn, using it as a tightrope, a hammock, a limbo stick, etc. And Weenie has her favourite toy back.

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Ding-a-ling! Ding-a-ling! Oswald and Weenie rush to the window of their flat to see Johnny Snowman in the street below selling ice cream from his ice cream truck. They run downstairs in search of a swizzleberry swirl and a vanilla dog biscuit only to find that the truck has already left. They try to catch up with it only to find the ding-a -lings they hear are coming from everything but the truck. Disappointed, they head for home. As they turn the corner into Fish Street, they spot Johnny trying to change the tyre. Oswald eagerly helps him and, as a reward, gets his favourite ice cream for free - and of course a vanilla dog biscuit for Weenie!

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: There is a sand sculpture competition taking place on Fixham Beach and Leo is the designated Weather Forecaster for the day; his weather app assures him there is a heat-wave on the way. Mayor Madison is judging the teams (including late entrants Bob and Wendy) but loses a special loaned ring. The partly built sand sculptures are demolished in the search but the ring still isn’t found, so Mr Bentley fetches his metal detector and combs the beach while the sculptures are rebuilt. When the skies darken ominously, Leo realises he’s been checking the wrong Spring City and that a freak storm is heading for them.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: When an old factory needs demolishing to make way for a new skyscraper, Bob says they will need to bring down the factorys tall chimney using explosives. Lofty is nervous about the noise of the explosion, but Scoop hopes its as big and loud as possible. As they begin to knock down the main building, Lofty becomes increasingly spooked by unexpected crashes and bangs around the site - most of them caused by Scoop. Bob tries to reassure Lofty, but when Scoop surprises the crane by shouting KA-BOOM, Lofty accidentally smashes the girder hes carrying against the chimney and creates a hole. Now the chimney might fall the wrong way into the nearby street.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare has a new game. He will be Big Nutbrown Hare for a day, doing jobs like finding food, answering tricky questions and resting in the grass. Likewise, Big Nutbrown Hare must take on his son’s jobs of playing with his friends, making up new games and asking questions. It’s all great fun until they realize that they are much, much better at being themselves.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: A Summer storm sweeps across the valley and a nervous Little Nutbrown Hare and his friends scamper into a cave with Big Nutbrown Hare. They are all safe and dry in the cave, but the thunder outside is still scary. Big Nutbrown Hare explains that noises can’t hurt you… but will he help them overcome their fears enough to enjoy the storm and the wonders of nature that it brings?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: A lazy Summer’s day brings a wonderful discovery for Little Nutbrown Hare… a tree full of bright, beautiful, tasty plums! Little Nutbrown Hare isn’t the only one enjoying the juicy summer fruit, it seems like every animal in the meadow has come for a taste. As the Summer goes on the plums disappear and Little Nutbrown Hare begins to wonder what all the animals will do without them.

programme.title: Learning Time With Timmy
programme.desc: The class are playing hide and seek but Paxton is too noisy. Can you find Timmy and his friends in the garden?

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: The kids try to find the owner of a camera using the photos for clues. All the pictures are sporting events, so they eventually find out the camera belongs to the sports reporter for the Busytown Bugle./ A list Sally made mysteriously disappears right off the page.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world, Messy is in the kitchen preparing his breakfast. In this instance, just like most others, it’s a plateful of socks. Before he tucks in, he notices the fridge door is open. He jumps down from the breakfast table to shut it. “How do these things stick to the fridge?” he says looking at the collection of colourful magnets. “What are they? Why don’t they fall off? It’s like magic?” He vortexes himself to Okido to find out. He joins Zoe and Felix in the garden, who are busy packing things to take with them to the beach. At the command of Messy’s whistle, Okidoodle whizzes out of the garage and they’re on their way.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world, it’s a hot sunny day and Messy is playing outside in the sand pit. He tries to make some shade to cool himself down but in the process his ice lolly disappears! He wonders where it could have so he goes to Okido to find out. He lands with a soft, crunchy thud and looks around - thick white snow is everywhere! He finds Zoe and Felix in the garden who invite him to come and play in the park. Zoe and Felix decide to make “the biggest snowman Okido has EVER seen’’. Messy gets distracted by some giant footprints. He follows the trail and finds a large friendly snow creature called Snowden!

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: Blueberry invites Huck to attend Berry Bitty City’s big Masquerade Ball in honor of their new dog park. Unfortunately, Blueberry gets a cold and has to stay home. To keep Huck from being disappointed, Lemon decides to fill in for Blueberry at the Ball, unaware that Raspberry is doing the same thing! At the ball, “Blueberry” (actually Lemon) shows up, saying she feels all better. Later, Strawberry sees Blueberry again in another part of the park, unaware it’s Raspberry in an identical Blueberry disguise. Strawberry is increasingly puzzled at “Blueberry’s” strange behavior, and doubly puzzled to see Lemon’s puppy, and later Raspberry’s puppy, following her around.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry wants to surprise Mom when she returns home from shopping - so he decides he will play her some music.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry is impressed when he learns that Firemen dont just put out fires, they also rescue people.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Leo comes across a baby Asian elephant while planting an apple tree. To find the elephant’s mother, the Junior Rangers explore the lowland forest.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: The whole island is celebrating Christmas and there are decorations everywhere, but it doesn’t look very Christmassy at the scrap yard. Percy starts to worry that Reg is missing out and he tries to find something to take to Reg to cheer him up. But the only thing Reg seems happy about is scrap. Percy discovers that Reg is celebrating Christmas his own way and has been making his own decorations from scrap.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: One day while repairing an embankment, Marion strikes something hard and insists it must be the mast of a Viking Ship. It looks like a water pipe to Thomas but Marion is adamant that it isn’t. But the next day Thomas notices flooding near the bank and then there is a landslip and Marion has to admit her mistake and help prevent an accident.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Because of a domestic accident, Fumes hurt his foot and his wing. He must stay at home and not move at all. At Davids request, Grisu agrees to take care of his father as a nurse. But Fume is an unbearable patient and Grisu ends up giving in to his whims: to go and get a pizza at Marias. The journey turns into an adventure and Grisu realizes that the city is definitely not made for the disabled. For the return trip, he builds a kind of racing kart. Fume is so happy that he feels much better now, ready to go back for another pizza

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Grisus mission is to replace David in a camping trip where he was supposed to take the children. But his father accompanies them and makes a lot of mistakes, pretending he knows everything about camping! Grisu ends up burning the tent. Fortunately, he has the idea to make clay tiles with the help of his fathers flame. And so, he makes a shelter for him and his friends.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Summer is at its hottest and Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse want to run and play but the sun is just too hot and strong. That’s until Little Grey Squirrel gives them both a wonderful present, big leafy parasols. When he later changes his mind and takes Little Nutbrown Hare’s parasol back, the little hare is naturally disappointed. Can the friends find a way for all of them to be happy?

programme.title: David Oistrakh, Artist of the People ?
programme.desc: The dramatic story of an inspired violinist, of a loyal man whose self-imposed silence eloquently betrayed unspoken private suffering. This extensive profile features interviews with David Oistrakhs longtime friends and fellow musicians: Yehudi Menuhin showing what it takes to make a great violinist; Mstislav Rostropovitch talking of Oistrakhs relationship with the Soviet regime; Gidon Kremer recalling Oistrakh as a teacher; Gennady Rozhdestvensky who conducted all the major concertos for him.

programme.title: Yehudi Menuhin, le violon du siècle
programme.desc: Lord Yehudi Menuhin, relaxing at his home in the Greek isles, tells the story of his wonderful career on the eve of his 80th birthday. A wealth of rare archival material illustrates this highly informative and entertaining profile of the worlds greatest violinist, providing insight into the life of the young San Franciscan wonderchild, his sudden rise to stardom which led to an outstanding international career, his encounters with the worlds greatest musicians and music traditions, and his involvement in world politics.Subtitles available for this program with your remote control

programme.title: The Lost Paradise, a portrait of Arvo Part
programme.desc: He is the most performed contemporary composer in the world. Nevertheless, he also rarely ventures out in public, keeps quiet about his music, feels at home in the forests of Estonia and generates therewith – perhaps involuntarily – the impression of a recluse, which is attributed to him again and again: Arvo Part.The Estonian composer, who will celebrate his 90th birthday on September 11, 2025, verily exudes even solely by his appearance an aura of a mystic or an ascetic. He himself says: “I am no prophet, no cardinal, not a monk, not even a vegetarian.” But he is without a doubt a devout man, who has been a member of the Russian Orthodox Church since 1970, and under pressure from the Soviet apparatus of power was forced to leave his native Estonia in 1980. Via Vienna he arrived in Berlin, which for the next 30 years would become his second home and also the starting point for his international career.“The Lost Paradise” is the first international documentary about Arvo Part. It is quite an astonishment that such a shy artist has given his consent to be accompanied by a camera for an entire year: In his native Estonia, travelling to Germany, Italy, and Japan, where Part received the Praemium Imperiale, the world’s most prestigious award in the field of music, in October 2014.The film is framed by the identically named stage production “Adam’s Passion,” featuring three key works by Arvo Part, which American director Robert Wilson brought to the stage in May 2015 in a former submarine factory, the “Noblessner Foundry” in Tallinn.

programme.title: Hits Dont Lie
